bndTIC8f2rreRwHzfREN7w.text: Lovely place with most gracious hosts. We are traveling from US with kids. People at this restaurant were very understanding, helped us get settled with our food restrictions. Today we tried their chicken skewers and green curry. Very delicious. I strongly recommend it.

tLazBfvlOzE7F3RdHh3NKw.text: I went here last weekend while visiting and decided to try it as it was right around the corner from the hotel. We entered and were greeted and sat immoderately as we were dinning early. It is a small place so may want to check on reservations if going at a busier time. I had a feeling when I sat down it was going to be good as shrimp chips were on the table. Loved them! I started with the Thai fish cakes and had the green curry with prawns as my main. It was excellent! Service was awesome and the food was fantastic. Had a few tiger beers and made for a great experience. Will definitely go back!

zJvQbNSXUxIBECEzobHAkQ.text: Amazing food and service ! Some of the best chicken Satay and peanut sauce I have ever had. The stir fry was excellent. Great Tom yum soup. Everything we had was delicious. The people there was so gracious and friendly. Wonderful neighborhood gem. Great for kids as well.

wkWCSFXXJjTZAo6QGN3Gew.text: Very rude. We wait for 10 ministers to order but they just chose another customer. I can't help think this Thai have discrimination to another Asian. I prefer to reporting this issue in city council to tell how Thai to respect people instead being extremely arrogant. Bad service, simple dishes, arrogant attitude. I strongly suggest everyone to taste whatever the other Thai restaurants.

FnjewV9dlcL-CP-JxXDoUA.text: Been to spirit of thai for lunch and for dinner and both times have been very good experience; my favorites was the Phad Thai Goong Sod Kai Hor ; it was really delicious and the prawns were very well cooked; lunch menu is a three course menu for 11.5 which is very filling and really tasty; i just wished the dessert was more "thai" as it was simply a scoop of vanilla so maybe adding a little something would make it great; Overall i would recommend this place and just a heads up, it is pretty small so you might want to make a reservation;

photos.caption: Photo of Spirit of Thai - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Spirit of Thai - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

JkKj2rI8A2TqLgeT1sQ-Sg.text: High quality Thai food. Ambiance: Nice, quiet, clean.  Service: Friendly, attentive staff. Speedy service. Food: I had the scallops and prawn stir fry and it was delicious. a nice blend of flavours and both proteins cooked just right. Price: Perhaps a little on the high side compared to other places nearby but not too bad. A good choice for a bite to eat pre- or post-show.

VPnBtejzRqq9JOjOAnKtuw.text: Well this place was a pleasant surprise.  The first time I noticed here was actually walking back from Kanpai further down the road... saying to myself "that reminds me, I need to find a good Thai place in Edinburgh"... to my surprise this place had great reviews on Yelp, although not as numerous as other options, the reviews that were available were glowing and consistent.  For the record, my "surprise" noted above in the previous good reviews has more to do with the location and clean, almost chain like, look of the place... I would have (wrongly) assumed that the quality here would take a hit since they could pull people in based on being seen if that makes sense, so thanks Yelpers for convincing me to give the obvious option a chance!  Back to the review!  I'm essentially going to echo what's been said... the quality and freshness seemed top notch, and I have two testaments to how I felt about my meal... 1) my mouth is watering thinking about it at the moment, and 2) I'm eager to try some of their salads and other dishes based on my initial trip.  Upon my visit I uploaded pictures of my Tom Yum soup and Prawn Pad Thai... they both tasted as good as they looked. I would dare to say that the soup was missing that magic something from my top Thai place, Old Siam in York, but I've never seen anyone duplicate their take on Tom Yum... had it not been for the Old Siam this would now be my top pick for this Thai staple... tons of fresh ingredients and huge prawns that look like they could have put up a fight before going in, I'm definitely having this again. The Pad Thai was unlike one I've had before, literally wrapped in an omelette as stated on the menu, but it was also a joy... it reminded me of how Pad Thai can be in that it was bustling, exciting, and unique despite being such a popular dish... shame on places that serve unexciting Pad Thai... shame I say!  My friend had a sliced duck disk from the "wok" section... I wasn't too envious when it came out because, despite looking good, it didn't have the oomph that my Pad Thai did... it did have fresh bits of chilli, green "on the stem" peppercorns, etc., but the duck itself looked like it wouldn't pack much flavour. (Too many places can jazz up a plate of unflavourful meat so I've grown sceptical of these types of dishes over time.)  Upon sampling however I was quite pleasantly surprised... the duck had a great taste and the leftover juice, marinade, etc., was so good that I had to try some of his boiled rice with it... it's still not the type of dish I would order myself, I need more variety than meat and rice, but if that's you're thing then I don't imagine you would be disappointed.  The only slight negative is that the prices can seem a bit high at first (13 or so for the Pad Thai I believe, 6 something for the soup), but the portions are fitting of the prices... the soup wasn't main size huge, but definitely not your standard size, and the Pad Thai was big enough that I had to take some home to eat later that evening... even if the portions weren't suitably large I would rather pay a few pounds extra for something I really like and that's bustling with fresh ingredients as it was here, but that's just my take on it.  The place itself is cute, clean, and cozy without being too small, and despite being the only people in at 9:45 or so on a Sunday evening they were friendly and attentive without any hint of "why are these crazy people here so late" that you sometimes get upon late arrivals.  While in Edinburgh I dare say I'll likely be trying other dishes here before venturing out for comparisons, I suppose that speaks for itself.

photos.caption: Photo of Spirit of Thai - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The cute and just cosy enough interior.
Photo of Spirit of Thai - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Phad Thai Goong Sod Kai Hor, too much to finish so what&#39;s left is coming home with me... too tasty to leave behind.
Photo of Spirit of Thai - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Tom Yam Goong soup, a very good start to the meal!

gEeoGThp3JITom5YoG78Zw.text: Managed to book a table when the festival was on and all others refused to. This was the sole reason for trying out Spirit of Thai.   It was a great meal with my friends. All lovely, fresh dishes and generous portions. Finished off with simple banana fritters which topped off a great meal.  As good as most other well respected Thai restaurants in town.

Tcp6QR4WO87Z2MphWsZ96Q.text: If I lived here, I would go to Spirit of Thai all the time.  As it is, I had to talk my boyfriend out of eating every meal of our vacation at this restaurant, if only to be able to explore all of Edinburgh's offerings.  The service was incredibly gracious, but it was the food that has me thinking of this place from thousands of miles away.  You could tell the ingredients were as fresh as possible, and the flavors were complex and delicious. It was one of those occasions where I had to hide the remainder of my meal from myself to be able to resist the urge to keep eating once I was full. I didn't really have room left for the mango sticky rice, but we split it, and it was worth it.

EtcaRybBZVGI3ILX84QgXg.text: Amazing food and great attention to detail! Great dinnerware and silverware, napkins nicely folded, service was great.

ORWQp7k_hlxXrSQX0MAhGA.text: This restaurant is quite small but nice   The personnel is kind   The food is good but pay attention that you have big stuff. The chicken is not cut thin for exemple The price is correct for the city

FhMDejQQRa1P1YR__WpbQg.text: Recently went to Spirit of Thai for the first time and we will definitely be back!  Spirit of Thai is located in a fairly small location that is ideal for a relaxed meal. I wasnt sure I would find good, authentic Thai in Edinburgh, but this place exceeded my expectations. The presentations are beautiful, the food is really lovely and authentic, the portions are generous, the prices are reasonable, the service is impeccable, the atmosphere is enjoyable.   We started with a fishcake appetizer which was huge and so, so good. That sauce... what is it? Its heaven. We moved on to huge prawns fried in red curry and mixed seafood in coconut curry with a side of fried rice. Everything was of the best quality and beautifully presented. All washed down with a cold Singha beer. The service was perfect. Taking our coats, checking to see if everything was ok, removing empty plates, and offering hot jasmine hand towels at the end of the meal. Recommended!

7bvAMvw8hV-kcGv6XvYNUA.text: Good decor and good spot for a quiet romantic dinner. But the fishcakes were not good, fried rice was flavorless,  but coconut lime prawns dinner was good. A little pricey.

hfDZ-4ZZ0L62k-qY0En9yw.text: This is our best restaurant in Edinburgh. The dishes have exquiisite tastes. Can't remember the name but there is one fish dish in particular which boasts two different sauces. This is our favourite.

tEsR-cIz88Roc-hcHd9r-g.text: Was treated to lunch here today by my niece who works nearby! She had been several times before! There was a set lunch menu, 3 courses. not sure how much but I know it was very reasonable! The setting is lovely, the staff very attentive without being overbearing ant the ambience good. There were a few people in when we arrived but by the the time we left it was full! I would recommend booking a table! Service was quick & we easily managed in the lunch hour! The food was a good as anyThai I have tasted, particularly recommend the Hot & Sour soup! Definitely worth a visit!

rSJ7VeeoMUdef9W-tE_lCg.text: The freshness & quality of the food is one of the best I've had. For example I have never ever seen any restaurant actually use fresh pepricorn fresh meaning still green and on the plant itself.  They have such exotic spices and veggies flown in weekly from Thiland. That is amazing. Can't wait to go back there again.

8DKtLezXtp7_VnED7zRVCg.text: Certainly the best Thai food I've had. Complicated and fresh flavours. A wider selection than usual and very good vegetarian options. A bit pricey but the portions are on the large side as well. Service was fast efficient and very attentive- the best I've had in Edinburgh that wasn't at a location two to three times this price range ( and better than many of those). I've seen it get very busy, usually depending on if there is a show at the Lyceum across the street, but have always had luck getting a table on a weekday night.

rLca50QWt4VOgvmThaC8bA.text: This is a lovely little Thai restaurant in the centre of Edinburgh just next to the Usher Hall. It is quite small and sits around 30 people. The staff are very attentive and the service is great. The decor is fairly new and looks lovely.   There is a good selection of Thai food and plenty of choices for vegetarians as well. The food is lovely I can especially recommend the spring rolls. You also get some lovely Thai crackers to snack on whilst waiting for your meal. They do some lovely fish based meals.   Service is quick and the food is beautifully presented. Its not cheap but probably pretty average for a restaurant in the centre of town. Its a place I have been a few times and will go back again

CMCM5knkrgIY_Z-WrJUnKQ.text: You are probably going to need to book early, this place is popular. We needed to wait about 45 minutes for a table. Food was high quality and portions were more than enough. Would certainly recommend
